title: Blue Lock: Rivals Tier List
description: Explore the definitive tier list for Flows in Blue Lock: Rivals, detailing the strengths and strategic advantages of each to enhance your gameplay.
heading: Blue Lock: Rivals Tier List
introText: Explore the definitive tier list for Flows in Blue Lock: Rivals, detailing the strengths and strategic advantages of each to enhance your gameplay.

data.itemDescription: Enhances shot power and increases on-ball speed, allowing for extended dribbling maneuvers
Boosts shot power and speed, with the added advantage of curving basic shots, making it formidable in offensive plays
Provides additional dribbles and increases shot power; also grants teammates a 20% boost to their flow bars, making it versatile across positions
Accelerates shot release, enhances header power, and increases jump height by 50%, especially effective when paired with styles like Shidou or Nagi
Boosts stamina regeneration and decreases shot release time, offering balanced support for various positions
Reduces ability cooldowns by 25% during activation and enhances movement speed, offering flexibility across different playstyles
Increases shot power and prolongs the downtime of opponents after successful tackles, advantageous for midfielders focusing on disrupting enemy plays
Randomly grants a boost in speed, shot strength, or stamina, with a rare chance to enhance all three simultaneously; its unpredictability can be advantageous in various scenarios
Increases tackle hitbox and reduces cooldown, accompanied by a speed boost and quicker recovery from being knocked down, making it excellent for defensive strategies
Provides a speed boost and increased shot power immediately after receiving the ball, along with a 50% reduction in Trap & Dash cooldowns, making it suitable for quick offensive plays
Reduces dribble cooldown and eliminates speed penalties when controlling the ball, aiding midfielders in transitioning play from defense to offense

This flow provides a speed boost, making it advantageous for players seeking increased movement or action speed. It's especially beneficial for newcomers but can be replaced with higher-tier flows as players progress

This flow offers a basic power shot enhancement, which is useful for passing the ball but less effective for scoring goals. Due to its limited additional benefits beyond shooting power, it's considered a mid-tier option
